meanings.definition: To divide into three equal parts.
meanings.sent1: She was trisecting the cake to share with her two friends.
meanings.sent2: The teacher showed the students how to trisect a line segment in geometry class.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was trisecting the pizza to make sure everyone got a fair share.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to be trisecting the forest, creating three distinct sections.
meanings.sent5: The magician amazed the audience by trisecting a rope into three equal pieces.

meanings.definition: The act of dividing into three equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The trisecting of the land was necessary for the construction project.
meanings.sent2: She studied the art of trisecting in her math class.
meanings.sent3: The trisecting of the pie caused a playful argument among the siblings.
meanings.sent4: The trisecting of the city into three districts brought about new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The trisecting of the cake made it easier to distribute among the guests.
